main event: A possible weather balloon observed over Reno, Nevada on June 12, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as a silvery-grey reflection, approximately the size of a quarter held at arm's length.
The object was observed from a parked car, estimated to be 2,000 to 2,200 feet above the nearby Sierra Nevada mountain range, and approximately 3 to 4 miles from the observer.
The object was observed for approximately 15 minutes, with no apparent motion except for a sudden disappearance.
The Reno Weather Service had released a weather balloon in the area on the same day and time as the sighting.
The observer, Sgt. Douglas J. Lawson, was an experienced aircraft maintenance supervisor, which helped eliminate the possibility of the object being a conventional aircraft.
